meanings.definition: A person who has been honored for achieving distinction in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: The school's spelling bee laureate was celebrated for their excellent performance.
meanings.sent2: The Nobel laureate in literature gave a moving acceptance speech.
meanings.sent3: The baking laureate proudly displayed their award-winning cake at the fair.
meanings.sent4: She was the laureate of the science fair, her project shining brighter than the rest.
meanings.sent5: The music laureate's talent was like a beacon, guiding others to strive for greatness.

meanings.definition: To honor or crown with a laurel wreath.
meanings.sent1: The ancient tradition was to laureate the victor of the Olympic games.
meanings.sent2: In the play, the actors would laureate the hero at the end of the performance.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to laureate the best dish of the evening with a sprinkle of parsley.
meanings.sent4: The gardeners would laureate the most beautiful rose in the garden every year.
meanings.sent5: The queen would laureate the bravest knight with a wreath of laurels, symbolizing victory.
